title: Use Mosquito Nets
description: Always sleep under an insecticide-treated mosquito net.

title: Indoor Spraying
description: Spray insecticides on indoor walls to kill resting mosquitoes.

title: Wear Protective Clothing
description: Wear long sleeves and trousers, especially at night.

title: Drain Stagnant Water
description: Clear gutters, buckets, and puddles around your home.

title: Seek Early Diagnosis
description: Visit a health center quickly if you develop fever, chills, or headache.

title: Take Full Treatment
description: Always complete malaria medication even if you feel better.

title: Protect Children
description: Ensure children sleep under treated nets as they are more vulnerable.

title: Pregnancy Protection
description: Pregnant women should use preventive malaria drugs (IPT).

title: Screen Windows
description: Install mosquito screens on windows and doors to block entry.

title: Travel Prepared
description: Take malaria prophylaxis when traveling to high-risk zones.

title: Community Clean-Up
description: Participate in neighborhood clean-ups to destroy breeding sites.

title: Avoid Night Exposure
description: Limit outdoor activity at dusk and dawn when mosquitoes are active.

title: Use Insect Repellent
description: Apply DEET-based repellents on exposed skin.

title: Recognize Severe Symptoms
description: Confusion, seizures, or difficulty breathing need urgent care.

title: Don’t Self-Medicate
description: Avoid taking malaria medicine without proper diagnosis.

title: Check Blood Smear
description: Only a malaria test can confirm infection accurately.

title: Educate Family
description: Teach children and adults about mosquito bite prevention.

title: Stay Hydrated
description: Drink fluids when recovering from malaria to avoid dehydration.

title: Rest Well
description: Adequate rest helps the body recover faster from infection.

title: Report Outbreaks
description: Inform health workers about unusual malaria cases in your area.

title: Seasonal Awareness
description: Malaria risk is higher during rainy seasons – take extra care.

title: Bedtime Routine
description: Tuck mosquito nets properly around beds every night.

title: Avoid Fake Drugs
description: Buy malaria medicines only from trusted pharmacies.

title: Stay Informed
description: Follow local malaria alerts and government campaigns.

title: Care for the Vulnerable
description: Protect children under 5 and pregnant women first.

title: Drink Safe Water
description: Always boil or filter water before drinking.

title: Wash Hands Often
description: Use soap and safe water before eating and after toilet use.

title: Cook Food Thoroughly
description: Ensure all seafood and meat are well-cooked before eating.

title: Use ORS
description: If diarrhea starts, take Oral Rehydration Solution immediately.

title: Avoid Street Food
description: Street food may be contaminated. Eat freshly prepared meals at home.

title: Wash Fruits
description: Wash fruits and vegetables with clean water before eating.

title: Sanitary Toilets
description: Use clean toilets to prevent fecal contamination of water.

title: Safe Water Storage
description: Keep drinking water in clean, covered containers.

title: Dispose Waste Safely
description: Don’t dump waste in rivers or streams.

title: Avoid Raw Seafood
description: Do not eat raw shellfish or poorly cooked seafood.

title: Community Sanitation
description: Participate in clean-up campaigns to improve hygiene.

title: Use Chlorine Tablets
description: Disinfect water with chlorine before use.

title: Treat Clothes Properly
description: Wash clothes with safe water to avoid contamination.

title: Seek Early Care
description: If diarrhea persists, go to a health center quickly.

title: Breastfeed Infants
description: Exclusive breastfeeding protects babies from cholera.

title: Avoid Open Defecation
description: Always use toilets, never open fields or rivers.

title: Prepare ORS at Home
description: Mix 1L of water, 6 tsp sugar, and 1/2 tsp salt for quick ORS.

title: Cover Food
description: Keep cooked food covered to avoid flies.

title: Avoid Dirty Ice
description: Only use ice made from safe water.

title: Report Cases
description: Inform health workers about suspected cholera outbreaks.

title: Stay Hydrated
description: Drink water frequently to replace lost fluids.

title: Hand Hygiene for Caregivers
description: Wash hands after caring for a sick person.

title: Avoid Reheating Multiple Times
description: Reheated food repeatedly may harbor bacteria.

title: Community Awareness
description: Educate neighbors about safe water and hygiene practices.

title: Use Latrines Correctly
description: Keep toilets clean and always flush with water.

title: Change Pads Regularly
description: Change sanitary pads every 4–6 hours to prevent infections.

title: Dispose Pads Properly
description: Wrap used pads in paper and discard in a bin.

title: Wash Hands
description: Always wash hands before and after changing pads.

title: Use Clean Water
description: Clean the genital area with safe water daily.

title: Track Your Cycle
description: Use an app or calendar to track your monthly cycle.

title: Wear Comfortable Clothing
description: Loose-fitting clothes reduce discomfort during periods.

title: Avoid Perfumed Products
description: Avoid perfumed soaps and sprays in the genital area.

title: Carry Emergency Pads
description: Always keep a spare pad in your bag in case of emergencies.

title: Exercise Lightly
description: Light exercise helps reduce cramps and discomfort.

title: Eat Healthy
description: A balanced diet helps reduce bloating and cramps.

title: Stay Hydrated
description: Drink enough water to reduce bloating.

title: Heat Therapy
description: Use a hot water bottle to relieve menstrual cramps.

title: Avoid Smoking
description: Smoking can worsen cramps and menstrual health.

title: Rest Adequately
description: Get enough sleep during your period for better health.

title: Seek Medical Help
description: If periods are too painful, consult a health professional.

title: Avoid Sharing Pads
description: Never share menstrual products with others.

title: Maintain Privacy
description: Change pads in a safe, private space.

title: Educate Girls
description: Teach young girls about safe menstrual practices.

title: Carry Disposal Bags
description: Use small bags to dispose pads hygienically when outside.

title: Stay Active
description: Mild activities like yoga ease menstrual discomfort.

title: Avoid Sugary Foods
description: Sugar can increase bloating and cramps.

title: Support System
description: Talk with friends or family for emotional support.

title: Avoid Stress
description: Stress can worsen menstrual pain and irregularity.

title: Use Comfortable Pads
description: Choose products that feel comfortable for you.

title: Change at Night
description: Use longer, thicker pads for night protection.

title: Exclusive Breastfeeding
description: Feed babies only breast milk for the first 6 months.

title: Immunization
description: Ensure children receive all vaccinations on schedule.

title: Deworming
description: Give children deworming medicine every 6 months.

title: Balanced Diet
description: Provide meals rich in vegetables, fruits, and protein.

title: Safe Play
description: Allow children to play in clean, safe spaces.

title: Wash Hands Often
description: Teach children to wash hands with soap regularly.

title: Prevent Injuries
description: Keep sharp objects and medicines away from children.

title: Oral Hygiene
description: Brush children’s teeth twice daily with fluoride toothpaste.

title: Adequate Sleep
description: Children need 8–10 hours of sleep daily for growth.

title: Monitor Growth
description: Check weight and height regularly at health centers.

title: Avoid Sugary Drinks
description: Reduce sodas and sweet drinks to prevent obesity.

title: Regular Exercise
description: Encourage children to run, play, and exercise daily.

title: Screen Time Limit
description: Limit TV and phone usage to under 2 hours daily.

title: Dehydration Signs
description: Look for dry lips or sunken eyes; give fluids immediately.

title: Parental Bonding
description: Spend quality time to build children’s confidence.

title: Handwashing Before Meals
description: Always wash hands before children eat.

title: Vitamin Supplements
description: Provide Vitamin A and iron supplements when needed.

title: Breastfeeding at Night
description: Feed infants at night to promote better growth.

title: Safe Water
description: Ensure children only drink boiled or filtered water.

title: Avoid Junk Food
description: Reduce sweets, chips, and processed snacks.

title: School Hygiene
description: Teach children to keep clean at school.

title: First Aid Knowledge
description: Parents should learn basic first aid for emergencies.

title: Mental Health
description: Listen to children’s feelings and support emotional well-being.

title: Avoid Secondhand Smoke
description: Keep children away from cigarette smoke.

title: Regular Checkups
description: Take children for health checkups at least twice a year.
